name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: [NOISE].

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: >> This lecture is about some practical issues that you would have to address in

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: evaluation of text retrieval systems.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: In this lecture we will continue the discussion of evaluation.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: We will cover some practical issues that you will have to solve

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: in actual evaluation of text retrieval systems.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So
column6: in order to create a test collection
column7: we have to create a set of queries

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: a set of documents and a set of relevance judgments.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: It turns out that each is actually challenging to create.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So first
column6: the documents and queries must be representative. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _They must rep
column6: represent the real queries and real documents that the users handle. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And we also have to use many queries and

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: many documents in order to avoid biased conclusions.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _For the matching of relevant documents with the queries

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: we also need to ensure that there exists a lot of relevant documents for each query.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _If a query has only one that is a relevant document in the collection then

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: it's not very informative to compare different methods

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: using such a query because there is not much room for us to see difference.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So
column6: ideally there should be more relevant documents in the collection. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: But yet the queries also should represent real queries that we care about.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _In terms of relevance judgements
column6: the challenge is to ensure complete judgements _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _of all the documents for all the queries

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: Because we have to use the human labor to label these documents.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: It's very labor intensive.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _And as a result
column6: it's impossible to actually label all of the documents for _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _all the queries

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So
column6: this is actually a major challenge. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: It's a very difficult challenge.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _For measures
column6: it's also challenging because what we want with measures is that _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: with accuracy reflected the perceived utility of users.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: We have to consider carefully what the users care about and

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: then design measures to measure that.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _If we
column6: your measure is not measuring the right thing

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _then your conclusion would

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: So it's very important.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: So we're going to talk about a couple issues here.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _One is the statistical significance test

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _this also is the reason why we have to use a lot of queries

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: the question here is how sure can you be that I observed the difference?

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: It doesn't simply result from the particular queries you choose.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: So here are some sample results of average precision for System A and

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: System B in two different experiments.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _And you can see in the bottom

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So the mean
column6: if you look at the mean average position _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: the mean average positions are exactly the same in both experiments.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _All right
column6: so you can see this is 0.2

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: system B and again here its also 0.2 and 0.4.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: So they are identical.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _Yet if you look at the
column6: these exact average positions for different queries

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _if you look at these numbers in detail
column6: you will realize that in one case _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: you would feel that you can trust the conclusion here given by the average.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _In another case

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So
column6: why don't you take a look at all these numbers for a moment. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: Pause the video.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _we can easily say that

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So it's
column7: it's 0.4 and then this is twice as much as 0.2. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: So that's a better performance.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _But if you look at these two experiments and look at the detailed results

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: you will see that we'll be more confident to say that in the case one.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: In experiment one.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: In this case because these numbers seem to be consistently better than for system B.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _Where as in

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _because

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And this is another case where system A is better.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _But yet
column6: if we look at on the average

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: So what do you think?

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _You know
column6: how reliable is our conclusion if we only look at the average? _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _Now in this case
column7: we feel it's better than one

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: But how can we quantitatively answer this question?

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And this is why we need to do statistical significance test.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So the idea of a statistical significance test is basically to assess the vary

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: variance across these different queries.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _If there's a

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: that the results could fluctuate a lot according to different queries.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: Then we should believe that unless you have used a lot of

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: queries the results might change if we use another set of queries.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _Right? So

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: if you have seen high variance then it's not very reliable.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: So let's look at these results again in the second case.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So here we show two

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: One is a Sign Test.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _And we'll
column6: we'll just look at the sign. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _If System B is better than System A
column6: then we have a plus sign. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: When System A is better we have a minus sign etc.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _Using this case if you see this

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: We actually have four cases where System B is better.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: But three cases System A is better.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _You know intuitively
column6: this is almost like random results. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _Right
column6: so if you just take a random sample of to

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _and if you use plus to denote the head and then minus to denote the tail

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _that could easily be the results of just randomly flipping

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So
column7: the average is larger doesn't tell us anything. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _You know

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _And this can be quantitative in the measure by

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _And that basically

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: the probability that this result is in fact from random fluctuation.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _In this case

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: It means it surely is a random fluctuation.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _Now in Wilcoxon

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: and we would be not only looking at the signs

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: we'll be also looking at the magnitude of the difference.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _But
column8: we can draw a similar conclusion where you say well it's _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: very likely to be from random.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: So to illustrate this let's think about such a distribution.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And this is called a normal distribution.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: We assume that the mean is zero here.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _Let's say
column7: we started with the assumption that there's no difference _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: between the two systems.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: But we assume that because of random fluctuations depending on the queries

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _we might observe a difference
column6: so the actual difference might be _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _on the left side here or on the right side here

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _And
column6: and this curve kind of shows the probability _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: that we would actually observe values that are deviating from zero here.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _Now

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _we see that if a difference is observed here

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _then the chance is very high that this is in fact

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _a random observation

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _We can define region of you know
column6: likely observation because of random fluctuation. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And this is 95% of all outcomes.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And in this interval then the observed values

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: may still be from random fluctuation.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _But if you observe a value in this region or a difference on this side

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: then the difference is unlikely from random fluctuation.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _Right
column6: so there is a very small probability that you will observe _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: such a difference just because of random fluctuation.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So in that case
column6: we can then conclude the difference must be real. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: So System B is indeed better.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So
column6: this is the idea of the statistical significance test. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: The takeaway message here is that you have used many queries to avoid

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: jumping into a conclusion as in this case to say System B is better.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: There are many different ways of doing this statistical significance test.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So now
column6: let's talk about the other problem of making judgements and _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _as we said earlier

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: it's very hard to judge all the documents completely unless it is a small data set.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So the question is
column6: if we can't afford judging all the documents _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _in the collection

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And the solution here is pooling.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And this is a strategy that has been used in many cases to solve this problem.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: So the idea of pulling is the following.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _We would first choose a diverse set of ranking methods

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: these are types of retrieval systems.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And we hope these methods can help us nominate

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: likely relevance in the documents.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: So the goal is to pick out the relevant documents..

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: It means we are to make judgements on relevant documents because those

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: are the most useful documents from the users perspective.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So
column6: that way we would have each to return top-K documents. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _And the K can vary from systems

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: But the point is to ask them to suggest the most likely relevant documents.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And then we simply combine all these top-K sets to form

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: a pool of documents for human assessors to judge.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _Each will return K documents

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: we form the unit.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _Now
column6: of course there are many documents that are duplicated

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: because many systems might have retrieved the same random documents.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: So there will be some duplicate documents.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _And there are

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _there are also unique documents that are only returned by one system

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: of having diverse set of result ranking methods is to ensure the pool is broad.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And can include as many possible random documents as possible.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And then the users with the human assessors would make

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _complete the judgements on this data set

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And the other unjudged documents are usually just a assumed to be non-relevant.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _Now if the pool is large enough

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _But the
column6: if the pool is not very large
column7: this actually has to be reconsidered

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: and we might use other strategies to deal with them and

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: there are indeed other methods to handle such cases.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And such a strategy is generally okay for

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: comparing systems that contribute to the pool.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: That means if you participate in contributing to the pool then it's

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: unlikely that it will penalize your system because the top

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: ranked documents have all been judged.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _However

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: even evaluating a new system that may not have contributed to the pool.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _In this case
column7: a new system might be penalized because it might have _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: nominated some relevant documents that have not been judged.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: So those documents might be assumed to be non-relevant.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _And that

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So to summarize the whole part of text retrieval evaluation

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: it's extremely important because the problem is an empirically defined problem.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _If we don't rely on users
column6: there's no way to tell whether one method works better. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _If we have inappropriate experiment design

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: we might misguide our research or applications.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And we might just draw wrong conclusions.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And we have seen this in some of our discussion.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So
column6: make sure to get it right for your research or application. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: The main methodology is Cranfield evaluation methodology and

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _this is near the main paradigm used in all kinds of empirical evaluation tasks

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: not just a search engine variation.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: Map and nDCG are the two main measures that should definitely know about and

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: they are appropriate for comparing ranking algorithms.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: You will see them often in research papers.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: Perceiving up to ten documents is easier to interpret from users perspective.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: What's not covered is some other evaluation strategy like A-B test

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: where the system would mix two of the results of two methods randomly.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And then will show the mix of results to users.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _Of course
column6: the users don't see which result is from which method. _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: The users would judge those results or

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: click on those those documents in in a search engine application.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _In this case
column7: the search engine can keep track of the clicked documents

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: see if one method has contributed more to the clicked documents.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _If the user tends to click on one the results from one method

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _then it's just that method may

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: So this is what leverages a real users of a search engine to do evaluation.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _It's called A-B Test
column6: and it's a strategy that's often used by _

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _the modern search engines

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: Another way to evaluate IR or

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _text retrieval is user studies

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: I've put some references here that you can

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: look at if you want to know more about that.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: _So there are three additional readings here

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: these are three mini books about evaluation.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And they are all excellent in covering a broad review of information retrieval and

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: evaluation.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: And this covered some of the things that we discussed.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: But they also have a lot of others to offer.

name: 3 - 9 - 2.8 Evaluation of TR Systems- Practical Issues (00-15-14).srt
text: [MUSIC]
